country needs to reform the national curriculum to stop future generations falling behind on the global stage. Michael Gove criticised the current guidelines on history teaching for failing to include key figures from British history. No Churchill, no Queen Elizabeth, no Gladstone, no Disraeli, no Florence Nightingale , no Horatio Nelson , he wrote. Michael Gove said the current history curriculum only mentioned two names: William Wilberforce , architect of the movement to abolish the slave trade and Olaudah Equiano , a freed slave whose autobiography persuaded MPs to ban slavery
